comments.body: I think it's fine in this case since I don't think there are likely any users of MapStagingArea just yet (and definitely none internally), but generally adding new optional parameters should go at the end of the list, otherwise you break all callers that haven't been using named parameters.
Agreed. In this case I wanted to change the signature before it made it into the final release.

diffHunk:

  def get(self, key=None, indices=None, name=None):
    """
    If the key is provided, the associated (key, value)

comments.body:
@ekelsen I just realized I forgot to include the equivalent of the lines that [uses parallel_stack to combine batches](https://github.com/tensorflow/benchmarks/blob/b9221114d1261ec28f103455178abcfbeeb9b498/scripts/tf_cnn_benchmarks/preprocessing.py#L378) together. Do you think that belongs here as well or should it stay in user code? 

However, leaving things as they are may make sense. That's because this code contains full records they'll need to reorganize according to their features so they can do that as they need.

```
      for device_index in xrange(self.device_count):
        images[device_index] = tf.parallel_stack(images[device_index])
        label_index_batch[device_index] = tf.concat(labels[device_index], 0)
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +2212,2216 @@        for index, protobuf in zip(six.moves.range(len(records)), records):
          batch_index = index % self._batches
          batch_list[batch_index].append(protobuf)
        return batch_list
